description.value: Pregnancy or gravidity is the condition in which a woman carries a fertilized egg, which grows into an embryo and then a fetus. A pregnancy of between 37 and 42 weeks is considered normal. “Term pregnancy” is 37 to 42 weeks. The term gravidity is also used for the number of times a woman has been pregnant. This and parity - the number of times a woman has given birth - provides insight into the patient’s obstetric history.

purpose.value: A derived profile from [zib-Pregnancy.PregnancyDuration](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/zib-Pregnancy.PregnancyDuration) to provide a version better suited for implementation purposes. This profile augments the base profile with elements found in the various use cases that have adopted the zib.

comment.value: This profile on the Observation resource represents the PregnancyDuration concept (NL-CM:7.14.4) of zib Pregnancy. It can be used together with the [nl-core-Pregnancy](http://nictiz.nl/fhir/StructureDefinition/nl-core-Pregnancy) profile on the Condition resource, which can be referenced using `Observation.focus`.
